intro: Indigofera pellucida, commonly known as slender indigo, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces slender, hairy stems that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Indigofera pellucida is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it a valuable plant in agricultural settings.
